definition: to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: But it wasn't able to leverage those offerings with the relative smattering of users it had.
sentences.chinese: 持股者承認的是沒有大型社區就無法將那些資產套現。

sentences.english: The illegal-cash-advance is one of the major fraud risks of the credit-card industry.
sentences.chinese: 信用卡套現是信用卡產業面臨的一種主要風險。

sentences.english: You don’t need credit cards for cash-back bonuses.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要用信用卡進行紅利套現。

sentences.english: As the index goes up, there is more and more pressure on cash flows.
sentences.chinese: 隨着股指的走高，獲利盤的套現壓力越來越大。
